author: Special Correspondent
text:
Five shops in Yeshwantpur commercial complex were sealed by the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) for not paying rent for nearly five years.

According to a communiqué on Saturday, though the owners claimed that they had remitted old rental rates, the BBMP officials said that several notices under the Karnataka Municipal Corporations Act, 1976, had been issued asking them to pay rents as per the revised rates, but many had not complied with it.

After the shops were sealed, the owners gave cheques for Rs. 98,000.
title: Five shops sealed
